contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an expression to give advice. "Putting on armor" is metonymy for getting prepared for battle. "Tell Ben Hadad, 'Do not boast as if you have already won a battle that you have not yet fought.'" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/writing-proverbs]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: Tell Ben Hadad, 'No one who is just putting on his armor ... as if he were taking it off.'
